reviewText: I bought Robbie Coltranes Incredible Britian video and it is worth every penny. Very funny and the tour he takes you on is awesome. I learned so much and was totally humored along the way. I borrowed it originally from the library and loved it so much I ordered a copy for myself from Amazon.

Robbie Coltrane from Cracker: The Complete Collection , Hagrid of the Harry Potter movies, and the cashier from Let It Ride takes a vintage Jaguar XK-120 from London to Newcastle, driving B-roads (secondary roads) and exploring some of the oddities of the UK countryside. It's a good watch, although luckily for Robbie, these are far nicer and wider than the B-roads I'm accustomed to in East Anglia & the West Country. Coltrane is a wee bit rude, but if the viewer realizes the programs are aimed at a non-American viewership, it is very enjoyable.

I bought Robbie Coltranes Incredible Britian video and it is worth every penny. Very funny and the tour he takes you on is awesome. I learned so much and was totally humored along the way. I borrowed it originally from the library and loved it so much I ordered a copy for myself from Amazon.

Robbie Coltrane from Cracker: The Complete Collection , Hagrid of the Harry Potter movies, and the cashier from Let It Ride takes a vintage Jaguar XK-120 from London to Newcastle, driving B-roads (secondary roads) and exploring some of the oddities of the UK countryside. It's a good watch, although luckily for Robbie, these are far nicer and wider than the B-roads I'm accustomed to in East Anglia & the West Country. Coltrane is a wee bit rude, but if the viewer realizes the programs are aimed at a non-American viewership, it is very enjoyable.
Is there anything better than Rubeus Hagrid touring you around Great Britain? Honestly.
Love Coltrane in all his incarnations: brilliant DVD.

Outstanding!  I am a Robbie Coltrane fan since watching Cracker. His touring of the "B" roads of Great Britain with all the stops and interesting activities was delightful. I wish that he would make additional touring DVD's. No doubt i will watch this many times.

This 3-segment program is a wonderful excursion through the British countryside, with host Robbie Coltrane (Harry Potter's Hagrid, and star of numerous Brit TV programs including Cracker) stopping in to experience a variety of things including stone cutting for a stately country home. While I would have preferred more of the town and country views (what is shown is wonderful), the combination of elements combined with Coltrane's non-fussy presentation makes this engaging and enjoyable viewing.

I watch this all the time. Way better than the typical travel show where you see all the "normal" things in the UK.. Mr. Coltrane is a very personable fellow and I thoroughly enjoyed his "chats" with the viewers about the things he's seeing and doing.

This series is amazing. The actor who plays hagrid in Harry potter is actually a comedian - a real one - meaning he is hilarious. He travels through Britain to check out the bizarre festivals and such that take place.  He drives a classic car and his smoky, gravely voice is memorizing.  Wish there were more!!!
This was very entertaining and I enjoyed it.  I was a little disappointed that more time was not spent in my own part of the country, Co. Durham.
